intro: Calochortus weedii var. weedii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single flower stem that rises above the foliage. Calochortus weedii var. weedii is often found in California and Nevada, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
